data.title: Lots of Chopped steak on my salad
data.text: Wow!  The salad I had was enough for two.  Great margaritas, fresh/warm chips, flavorful salsa.  We loved it and will go back!

data.title: Nice surprise downtown
data.text: Started our meal with excellent chips and salsa.  Ordered a La SandiaRita margarita which was delicious (watermelon was a nice addition).  We ordered the Shrimp Fajitas (flavorful, well-seasoned and plentiful) and the Risotto Relleno (something I had never heard of but may very well be my new favorite Mexican dish).  The atmosphere was wonderful as we sat on the edge of the patio and enjoyed the cool evening breeze.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  One of our favorite meals in Santa Rosa.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We came to Santa Rosa for just one night and was recommended by our hotel for the great chips and salsa. We came for both lunch and dinner and we loved both meals. We had the shrimp and the quesadilla along with the potatoes and ceviche. Everything came out great and we would be back again for sure.

data.title: Good Mexican in upscale atmosphere
data.text: Good food and good service with a nice atmosphere. I recommend it for dinner. They had music upstairs as well that changed frequently. See whats playing!

data.title: Awesome Margaritas
data.text: The LaRosarita is highly recommended, a unique twist to your basic margarita. We loved everything we ordered. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted very fresh...the tomatoes in my quesadilla were awesome.

data.title: Great place to have dinner
data.text: We really enjoyed La Rosa. The food was fantastic and the service was very good. We ate there on a Monday evening and it was not crowded at all.  It was very nice out on the patio.

data.title: surprisingly good food!
data.text: I go for lunch almost once a week.  The food is really good.  Try the soups.  I'm kind of a snob about soup and don't eat it a lot because of that and let me tell you, their tortilla soup and chicken verde soups are fab!  Love their chicken chimichurri torta too.  Happy hour is lively, there is a full bar and the margaritas are great of course.

data.title: Average Food, fun environment
data.text:
This place was so lively that we were excited to be trying it out.

The food was tasty but on the average side.  The wait staff was ok, our waitress seemed always in a rush or maybe was an off night for her.  

We would try it again to give another try because it the environment was so fun.

data.title: Great taste and generous portions
data.text: Great service, solid size portions with great (spicy) flavors for lunch. Only slight negative is the construction work next door which ruins the nice breezy terrace outside.

data.title: Average food and atmosphere
data.text: Several of us went for drinks and appetizers for a retirement party.  The staff was nice and showed us to our seats, however being a larger party they had split the tables.  We asked that they be put together and they were hesitant to do so.   The appetizers were good, mini tacos, taquitos and quesadillas.  As the restaurant feel that they started seating people in our area so we wrapped up our party and move to another location.  I have not had dinner here recently so cannot speak to the overall food quality however the appetizers were good.

data.title: Delicious veggie tower!  Must try!!
data.text: The food was excellent as was the service. We will definitely try again.   I had the portobello veggie tower with jalapeños rice and my husband had the steak fajita.  Both were amazing!

data.title: The margarhitas are great
data.text: The building is unique and service fine but the burrito was just ok. The selections of tequila are outstanding hence the name.... I would definitely stop in for a drink and possibly dine elsewhere

data.title: Much needed good food
data.text: Great place for tasty food fast. We loved the soups and the steak. Local and further afield wines and great cocktails. Perfect for hungry travellers and recommended by a local.

data.title: Sweet location and setup of bar and dining
data.text: Dropped in during Peggy Sue classic car event. The outdoor seating was superb and the bar area is clean and welcoming. Beers on tap were super cold and good selection. Great upstairs bar option to overlook the downtown activities.

data.title: Great Food and Margs
data.text: Went here for a family dinner and the food was very delicious and the margaritas were great!  We were a party of 21 and the food came out fast.  Excellent salsa and chips to start.

data.title: Great food, nonexistent service.
data.text:
To be fair, the rating should be 2.5. The food was a 5 and the service a 0. I saw my server when she took my order and when she dropped off the bill, it's what I call ghost service.
If you decide to give them a try, the carne asada was amazing. Another must try is the Rosa Rita, one of the better margaritas I've enjoyed.
Very nice setting, with inside or outside dining, I might try again when I'm in the area and hope to avoid "that" server.

data.title: Cool place
data.text: I would say it is a typical Mexican restaurant in the US - huge portions, so be careful what you order, a starter can easily be enough for 2 people as main. The quality is OK, do not expect a super quality experience, but you wouldn't anyway, even though the interior and the building and the location is really superb. The service is nice, everyone is kind, but we had a feeling of "rushed through" the dinner as the main courses were brought in while we still were at the starters....

data.title: Great mojitos
data.text:
Good Mexican food with some great cocktails.

Just be sure to be hungry before you go as portions are large.

Kitchen closes at 9.00 pm on weekdays, so be mindful to order deserts before. The fried ice cream was amazing and large enough for two to share.

data.title: Great Mexican Restaurant
data.text: The food is outstanding .  One of my friends had the prawns special, and the other had the fajitas - they both enjoyed their meals  I had the carne asade -- the beef was perfectly seasoned and very tender.  The salsa with the chips was very good as well.  Service was very attentive and friendly.  I like the look of the place -- not overly glitzy, but it help sets the mood.  On a nice night there is outdoor seating as well.  Not overly pricey, but also not cheap.

data.title: No Surprises
data.text: Mexican restaurant with safe food choices.  Celebrated a birthday at the restaurant....a little disappointed that no questions were asked and no birthday treat was offered to the birthday girl.  Food was brought promptly, and drinks were kept refilled.  Kids ate without complaint.
